newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee gains on poor dlr demand, RBI abstains.
newsitem.headline: India rupee gains on poor dlr demand, RBI abstains.

text.p: The Indian rupee gained to 35.76/77 against the dollar on Wednesday from 35.78/79 opening on weak demand for dollars amid good supplies, dealers said.
They said the rupee's appreciation was expected.
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) did not intervene in the market to arrest the rupee's rise, they said.
The rupee touched a high of 35.7675 and a low of 35.7850 during the day. The forward premiums were steady after easing from the opening levels, dealers said.
